critique: The document is a formal presidential order addressing labor disputes at Montgomery Ward and Company during wartime. It conveys a sense of urgency and determination to maintain operations critical to the war effort. It uses formal and direct language, focusing on the necessity of the actions being taken. There is no explicit expression of joy, sadness, or surprise. There is a sense of disgust and anger towards the failure of Montgomery Ward and Company to comply with directive orders. There is also a sense of fear about the war effort being unduly impeded or delayed by these interruptions.
